content: This is very good for transaction latency as well. We‚Äôd like to ensure that there is as little distance between the proposer commitment and the release of the exec payload, otherwise this could negate many of the gains of shorter slot times

author: potuz
content: yeah definitely, I believe we are forced anyway to keep moving the PTC deadline according to the gas limit (in principle we could specify it as a function of it). But the nice thing about Mark's idea is that it leaves the maximum broadcast for blobs all the time constant at the end of the slot

author: barnabemonnot
content: why are we forced to move it according to the gas limit, assuming we always have enough time to execute by the time the propagation interval is over? (and even better if nodes can receive blobs without blocking execution)

author: potuz
content: I think there's always an incentive to delay the Payload, so it's in the protocol interest to force the Payload reveal to be as early as possible and the blob DA to be as late as possible

author: barnabemonnot
content: Right but moving the PTC forward in time just eats on your releasing blob DA budget no? So if you do this, then the higher the gas limit is, the lower you would set the PTC to?

author: potuz
content: We will have two deadlines: Payload availability and blob availability. The latter is stably at the end of the slot. The former should be the minimum time that takes to propagate the largest block at the given gas limit starting from the attestation deadline

author: barnabemonnot
content: Ah ok yes I think this is good to explore. I thought you meant using a single deadline, the PTC being an availability committee for both blobs and the exec payload

author: barnabemonnot
content: So in this world with two deadlines ‚ÄúPTC‚Äù is really just ‚Äúpayload‚Äù, and then there is a ‚ÄúBTC‚Äù (blob timeliness committee? üò¨)

author: barnabemonnot
content: How early do you think the attestation deadline can be? Is 1s enough time for beacon block propagation/attestation?

author: potuz
content: No the idea is that the PTC enforces both. They attest late but they only attest to the Payload being timely if it was before the earlier deadline
